snippet: As President Xi Jinping prepared to visit the United States, Washington warned of possible sanctions over digital attacks. Beijing pushed back by organizing a technology forum of industry leaders.
abstract: Chinese government invites executives from top American companies to technology forum in Seattle in effort to demonstrate its influence on American tech industry ahead of Pres Xi Jinping's visit to United States; Obama administration sees forum, which will feature Lu Wei, tech czar who oversees restrictions on foreign companies, as response to increasingly hard line it has taken against Chinese digital attacks and industrial espionage.

byline.original: By PAUL MOZUR and JANE PERLEZ
byline.contributor: Paul Mozur reported from Hong Kong and Jane Perlez from Beijing. Yufan Huang contributed research from Beijing and Nick Wingfield contributed reporting from Seattle.

lead_paragraph: As President Xi Jinping prepared to visit the United States, Washington warned of possible sanctions over digital attacks. Beijing pushed back by organizing a technology forum of industry leaders.

headline.main: China Flexes Tech Muscles Before a State Visit
headline.print_headline: China Flexes Tech Muscles Before a Visit
